alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 1:50PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Cumberland. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 148 PM EDT, Automated rain gauges indicated small stream flooding occurring on Rockfish Creek at Research Drive, south of Fayetteville. - Rockfish Creek at Research Drive is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Rockfish Creek and Cape Fear River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hope Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
